name: germanist
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
connected with the study of the language, literature, and culture of Germany: This view drew upon 19th-century liberal traditions, such as Germanist legal thought. His rewriting of the textbook took account of the Germanist theories of the group.
More examplesFewer examplesThere was now a more definite Germanist slant to his writings.

a person who studies the language, literature, and culture of Germany: As a Germanist, I was delighted to find the work of Goethe given detailed treatment in this book. He was a respected Germanist, and held a professorship in Berlin.
More examplesFewer examplesShe was a leading Germanist, whose scholarship encompassed an incredibly wide range.I hope that I have not upset any serious Germanists out there.
